evidence.text: In this action, the United States seeks a declaratory judgment that Idaho’s law is invalid under the Supremacy Clause and is preempted by federal law to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA.

extracted.value: preemption under the Supremacy Clause and EMTALA

evidence.text: A declaratory judgment stating that Idaho Code § 18-622 violates the Supremacy Clause and is preempted and therefore invalid to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA;

extracted.value: declaratory judgment that Idaho Code § 18-622 violates the Supremacy Clause and is preempted

evidence.text: A declaratory judgment stating that Idaho may not initiate a prosecution against, seek to impose any form of liability on, or attempt to revoke the professional license of any medical provider based on that provider’s performance of an abortion that is authorized under EMTALA;

extracted.value: declaratory judgment that Idaho may not initiate a prosecution against, seek to impose any form of liability on, or attempt to revoke the professional license of any medical provider based on that provider’s performance of an abortion that is authorized under EMTALA

evidence.text: A preliminary and permanent injunction against the State of Idaho—including all of its officers, employees, and agents—prohibiting enforcement of Idaho Code § 18-622(2)-(3) to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA;

extracted.value: preliminary and permanent injunction against the State of Idaho

evidence.text: Any and all other relief necessary to fully effectuate the injunction against Idaho Code § 18-622’s enforcement to the extent it conflicts with EMTALA;

extracted.value: any and all other relief necessary to fully effectuate the injunction against Idaho Code § 18-622’s enforcement to the extent it conflicts with EMTALA

evidence.text: The United States’ costs in this action;

extracted.value: United States’ costs in this action

evidence.text: Any other relief that the Court deems just and proper.

extracted.value: any other relief that the Court deems just and proper

evidence.text: The Supremacy Clause provides that “[t]his Constitution, and the Laws of the United States which shall be made in Pursuance thereof . . . shall be the supreme Law of the Land . . . any Thing in the Constitution or Laws of any State to the Contrary notwithstanding.” U.S. Const. art. VI, cl. 2.

extracted.value: Supremacy Clause (U.S. Const. art. VI, cl. 2)

evidence.text: EMTALA expressly preempts State laws “to the extent that the requirement directly conflicts with a requirement of this section.” 42 U.S.C. § 1395dd(f).
